title: Best practices for license management
content:
SAM provides a comprehensive solution for software license management, allowing you to manage your license effectively, control the company's budget for software licensing, and avoid potential compliance risks. Effective license management improves the transparency in software license usage across your organization, enabling you to make full use of the available license points and help optimize future business decisions. The best practice documentation includes the following license upgrade scenarios:

  1. Automatic license upgrades as per maintenance contracts
  2. License upgrades with metric changes
  3. License upgrades via purchasing upgrade licenses

Concepts

SAM needs to check the following aspects as the prerequisites for managing license upgrades that will decide which license upgrade scenario the upgrade is applicable to.

Concept Description
License model License model is essential for license management and defines the characteristics of each license. It's linked to every individual license and contains common attributes like the license metric and software version coverage, specified in the Software coverage section. Additional details such as Count per pack, Pack price, and Currency can also be included.
For more information about license model, see Edit a license model.
License type

Perpetual & subscription license

  • A perpetual license indicates the license rights are permanently available. With effective maintenance contract, you‘re entitled to access the latest version without additional cost. You can create a perpetual license by checking the Perpetual license checkbox.
  • A subscription license is only available during a certain period. Once it expires, you'll have no access to use the software. You can create a subscription license by clearing Perpetual license checkbox. The Start date and End date fields indicate the availability period of the subscription license.

Full license & upgrade license

  • A full license grants you independent access to the corresponding version or its lower versions.
  • An upgrade license is a separate license that must be combined with previous base licenses to obtain the desired rights. Upgrade licenses can't be used on their own and are useless without base licenses.
License phase

Service Management employs a system of metaphases and subordinate phases to indicate the status of licenses at different stages of their lifecycle in the license management process. The metaphases are comprised of Unavailable, Available, In use, Retiring, and End of Life. SAM identifies effective licenses by recognizing their subordinate phases, including customer subordinate phases, in the Available or In use metaphase.

The out of the box subordinate phases are:

  • The Available metaphase includes the subordinate phase of Receive.
  • The In use metaphase includes subordinate phases: Pool and Prepare.
License use rights

License use rights refer to the terms and benefits provided by the end user license agreement.

Note: License use rights configuration is only available for perpetual licenses. For subscription type license, there's no need to configure the use rights.

For more information, see Use rights.
Effective license summary

SAM builds an effective license summary against product licenses, covering the use cases outlined in this document. With this information, you can know what effective licenses you are entitled to use and how many licenses are consumed by your organization. You can view effective license summary in Compliance and Analysis.

Note that the license summary is calculated per product. If you add a new license, it may not immediately reflect in the effective license summary as SAM takes some time to rebuild the summary accordingly.
License compatibility matrix The license compatibility matrix includes license downgrade matrix and upgrade matrix.
  • Downgrade matrix: Most publishers provide downgrade rights in license agreements, which legally grants you to use a prior version of the software.
    You can define the version downgrade and edition downgrade in the downgrade matrix.
    • Version downgrade: License downgrade among versions with same edition like from the higher Standard version to the lower Standard version.
    • Edition downgrade: License downgrade among versions with different editions. For example, downgrade license from the Enterprise edition to the Standard edition.

Note: SAM tries version downgrade first. If no edition downgrade is available, only version downgrade occurs.

  • Upgrade matrix: This grants you the rights to the higher version of the software when it's released.
    SAM includes version upgrade and edition upgrade:
    • Version upgrade: Normally, you'll be entitled to access new version rights of the product without additional cost as long as you have the effective maintenance contract.
    • Edition upgrade: For most publishers, purchasing a separate upgrade license is required to access license use rights of a different edition .

For more details, see Maintain license compatibility matrix.
Product release lifecycle SAM allows you to enter product release information in the Products page. This enables SAM to automatically enroll for new versions by comparing the Expires on date of a maintenance contract for a perpetual license or the End date of a subscription license.
License rule SAM offers out-of-the-box license rules for supported software that comply with the licensing rules of the publishers to calculate license usage. It's a best practice to reuse the existing license rules for the same publishers when possible. If no matching rule is available, you can create a new license rule. For more information, see License rules.
Maintenance contract

Most software publishers provide maintenance contracts to grant the license upgrade capability.
To create a new maintenance contract for a license in Service Management, navigate to Service Management Contract Management, create the contract, and then add the Covered licenses to the contract. Note that if you leave the Expires on field empty, SAM will deem the licenses covered by the contract as "never expire" in its calculation.

For more information, see Create or update a contract record.

SAM license management workflow

When a new version of a product is released and deployed in the production environment, it's necessary to perform certain actions to ensure that the new version is properly licensed and remains compliant. You can refer to the diagram below for details on the SAM license management workflow. The actions that are highlighted in bold will be further discussed in the use cases provided below.

Supported license upgrade cases

Prerequisites

Software normalization

If the installed are not normalized, you need to use normalization rules to standardize them.
For steps on how to normalize the software, see Configurations.

You can skip this part, if you have run the  Inventory Discovery by Scanner job to discovery installed software based on the Software Application Index (SAI) files.

Maintain product version lifecycle

To maintain the product version lifecycle:

  1. Go to Products page and select the managed product.
  2. Go to product details page by selecting the Name or clicking on Details.
  3. From the General tab, select the product version from the Product version list and click Edit.
  4. Set Release date and click Save.

Maintain license compatibility matrix

To maintain the license compatibility matrix:

  1. Go to Products page and select the managed product.
  2. Go to product details page by selecting the Name or clicking on Details.
  3. Select License compatibility matrix tab.
  4. Check if all versions are correctly configured in Downgrade and Upgrade matrix.
    Note that if the product allows for the purchase of a separate upgrade license for a higher edition, click Edit compatibility type and select Edition upgrade as the Upgrade compatibility type.

For more details,see Maintain license compatibility matrix.

Currently, all products are synced from UD/UCMDB that means only installed product version in environment will appear in product version list. SAM doesn't support to create product and product versions manually.

License upgrade cases

Case 1: Automatic license upgrades as per maintenance contracts

SAM can automatically update the software license to its latest version, when the three conditions are met:

For perpetual licenses:

  • The license maintenance contract is effective when the new version is released.
  • The maintenance contract includes the license auto-upgrade services.

For subscription licenses:

  • The subscription license expiration date is later than the new version release date
  • The service contract is available.

To get SAM ready for automatic license upgrades according to maintenance contract, follow these steps:

For perpetual licenses:

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Software Asset > License Models.
  2. Click New to create a new license model, and the license general page opens by default.
  3. Under Software coverage subsection, input the values for License metric and Product version and other license-related fields, such as Count per pack, Pack price, and Currency.
    Note that the Product version specified in this section should indicate the version of the software that the license applies to. If the license applies to all available versions of the software and doesn't specify a supported version, it is recommended to link it to the latest supported product version available in the market.
  4. Go to the Run > Software Asset > Licenses page, and create a new license via clicking New.
  5. In the License detail, tick the Perpetual checkbox and select the created license model.
  6. Then, configure its Initialization options by changing its phase to the Receive, Pool, or Prepare subordinate phase.
  7. Go to the Contract management page via clicking Plan > Contract to create a new maintenance contract. In the Contract details section, set the Effective from and Expires on fields. In the Covered licenses subsection, add the newly created license into the list. Note that if you leave the Expires on field empty, SAM will deem the licenses covered by the contract as "never expire" in its calculation. 
  8. Go to newly created license from Run > Software Asset > Licenses.
  9. In the Maintenance section of General tab, set the Default maintenance contract to the created maintenance contract.
  10. Click Use rights tab, and check the Support upgrades when available checkbox in the Upgrade rights section.

For subscription license:

  1. Refer to steps 1-3 of perpetual license creation to create a new license model.
  2. Clear the Perpetual license checkbox. Set Start date and End date.
  3. Follow steps 7-9 of perpetual license creation to create a service contract.

When building effective licenses, SAM needs to consider the following rules:

  1. SAM will look up the Upgrade matrix in License compatibility matrix tab on the product details page to validate the upgradable versions. 
  2. SAM will compare the release dates of all upgradable product versions with the Expires on value on maintenance contract for perpetual licenses to decide the latest upgradable version during the effective period of maintenance contract. For subscription licenses, SAM will compare End date value on license with the release date of product versions. Note that if you leave the Expires on field on the maintenance contract (for perpetual licenses) or the End date field on the license (for subscription licenses) empty, SAM will deem the license as "never expire" in its calculation and the latest upgradable version will be the highest version available for the product.

Case 2: License upgrades with metric changes

Software publishers may change their license models and metrics of a product at any time due to rapid market and technological changes. The metric change is also recognized as license migration that will influence the license consumption results because the license rules change accordingly. The prerequisite is that you should have available maintenance contracts that support to upgrade to the versions that license metric change on.

To manage the license upgrades with metric changes, complete the following configurations:

  1. Go to the Run > Software Asset > Licenses page, and open the license details of a selected record.
  2. Open the Use rights tab. Note that Use rights tab is only available for a perpetual license.
  3. In the License migration section, input the values for the Migrate to and Total rights after migration fields.
    • The Migrate to field links to a specific license model which has expected license metric and product versions that license metric changed on or higher versions that can be covered by maintenance contract period.
    • The Total rights after migration field defines the total number of license points after the license migration happens.
    • If you want to partially migrate the license, split the license first.

When building effective licenses, SAM needs to consider the following rules:

  1. SAM will use Total rights after migration to build effective license rights.
  2. SAM will look up Upgrade matrix in the License compatibility matrix on the product details page to validate the upgrade path.
  3. If there's effective maintenance contract for an upgrade license, SAM will auto upgrade the license to its latest version from the current upgrade license. For more information, see the Case 1: Automatic license upgrades as per maintenance contracts section.

Case 3: License upgrades via purchasing upgrade licenses

Considering the software development cycle, new versions are usually based on the old versions. To get the latest version of software, you can either directly buy the full license of the new release or purchase an upgrade license. Currently, a number of software vendors provide a more economical business option of upgrade licenses that enables the customers who purchased the licenses for older software releases to use the new features available in the newest software releases. In this case, the upgrade licenses aren’t standalone licenses and need to work with the original base licenses.

Do the following to carry out the license upgrades via purchasing upgrade licenses:

  1. Following Run > Software Asset > Licenses, create a new upgrade license from the Licenses page. Select the Perpetual license and Upgrade license checkbox, and move its phase to the Receive, Pool, or Prepare subordinate phase.
    (Optional) You can utilize the license model for a full licenses by following step 1 of the perpetual license creation process to create a new licensing model in case 1.
  2. Go to the Contract management page via clicking Plan > Contract to create a new maintenance contract. In the Contract details section, set Effective from and Expires on fields. In the Covered licenses section, add the newly created license into the list.
  3. Go to newly created upgrade license and set Default maintenance contract field in the Maintenance section.
  4. Go to the previous license that you want to upgrade and open the license details page.
  5. Click Use rights tab and set Upgrade to field by selecting the new upgrade license in the Upgrade license ssection.
  6. To validate the configuration is successful, you can go to the details page of the new upgrade license and click its Use rights tab. If successful, the previous license should be displayed in the Upgrade from section.
  7. If you want to partially upgrade previous license, split the previous license first.

When building effective licenses, SAM needs to consider the following rules:

  1. If the license metric is the same for both previous and upgrade licenses, SAM will choose the minimum Total entitlements between them to avoid license wastes. If the license metric isn't the same, SAM will take advantage of the Total entitlements of upgrade licenses.
  2. SAM will look up Upgrade matrix in the License compatibility matrix on the product details page to validate the upgradable versions. If you want to upgrade among different editions, make sure the Edition upgrade is configured in the Upgrade matrix.
  3. If have effective maintenance contract for upgrade license, SAM will auto-upgrade the license to the latest versions from the current upgrade license. See the Case 1: Automatic license upgrades as per maintenance contracts section.

View effective license summary in Analysis

To view the license summary of the product, navigate to the Analysis page. On this page, you'll find the overall effective license summary that covers all the use cases mentioned above. If you want to know which license records make up the effective license pool, you can view the details of the effective license summary. For details, see View license compliance information.

Push compliance results to license usage

After performing compliance calculations, the results for the product's compliance will be returned to the License usage entity, which is grouped by license models. It's important to note that the SAM compliance report is based on the product version and license metric. When SAM returns the compliance results to the license usage record, it may match multiple records for the license model, product version, and license metric.
In these situations, SAM will follow the rules below to return the compliance results:

  1. Total entitlements, Consumed entitlements (for user-based products, including Assigned entitlements, Consumed entitlements, and Unassigned entitlements consumed), and Balance will be pushed to the matched license usage record with the latest value of Last Update Time on the linked license model.
  2. Purchased entitlements, Purchased upgrade entitlements, and Entitlements consumed by higher versions will be pushed to the matched license usage record by matching the license model, product version, and license metric.

If no license usage record is matched, a new license model will be created for review. For steps of how to cretae a new license model, see Create a license usage.

Limitations

SAM doesn‘t support to manually create products, and all products must be synced directly from the UD/UCMDB. If the purchased license is for a product version that doesn't exist in the UD/UCMDB, you can't link the correct product version to the license model in the Software Coverage section on the License Model page. To use the license, it's recommended to upgrade your installation to the newest version in your environment and then sync the product family from UCMDB again on the Products page.
